The rest of his body withered and rotted.
Only his tongue remained as it was.
It was the fourth year of Taiqing in Liang.
He was crowned the king of Xiangdong.
He was named Chengsheng.
He sent his captain, Wang Sengbian.
He conquered Hou Jing.
He then went to Nanling.
Sengbian.
He sent his deputy, Fahui.
He went to Jiangbei to supervise the military supplies.
Fahui died violently.
He went to sleep after five days.
He said.
"He went to King Yama's residence.
At the bottom of the stairs, he saw a monk.
The king first called to the monk.
He went up to him and asked.
"What was his business when he was born?
He replied.
He was reciting the Lotus Sutra.
The king sent someone to get a high seat.
The seat was exquisite.
The saṃgha ascended to the throne.
He recited the sutra for four pages or so.
The king got up in front of the throne.
He paid homage to him three times.
He sent someone to escort him up to the heavenly realm.
Hongzan fahua zhuan, vol. 6
